Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the photo was taken at the National Institutes of Health campus in Maryland, not at the Wuhan lab.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the connection between Obama, Fauci, and Gates by falsely suggesting they were at the Wuhan lab.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by misidentifying the woman in the photo as Melinda Gates when it is actually former Health and Human Services Secretary Sylvia Burwell.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it provides no evidence or credible sources to back up its claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the photo is from the Wuhan lab and that the individuals in the photo were involved in some nefarious activity.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided by the expert that the photo was taken at the NIH campus in Maryland and was related to Ebola research, not the COVID-19 pandemic.
